Description.val:
The Submarine Acoustic Warfare System (SAWS) program provides submarines with expendable defensive countermeasures and the systems necessary to externally launch them against torpedo and acoustic sensor threats. This program provides ongoing production of countermeasure devices needed to sustain fleet inventories, improvements to enhance the readiness and effectiveness of countermeasure devices and associated External Countermeasure Launcher (ECL) systems on all U.S. submarines. The expendable devices, Acoustic Device Countermeasures (ADC) are produced in two primary versions 3" ADC's are launched through the Internal Countermeasure Launcher (ICL) and 6" devices are launched through ECL Systems. An updated increased Acoustic Augmentation Support Program Ship Alteration (AASP SHIPALT) installation cost estimate has slowed installs through FYDP and funds are shifted to accommodate increases in Countermeasure Set, Acoustic (CSA) engineering technology refresh and insertion costs, driven by ADC MK5 Next Generation Countermeasure (NGCM) testing, and introduction in FY22-24.

WM018 - The Acoustic Augmentation Support Program (AASP) provides acoustic augmenting systems in appropriate configurations for all submarine classes (except SEAWOLF) installed as temporary equipment Temporary Alteration(TEMPALT). A permanently installed Ship Alteration (SHIPALT) configuration for VIRGINIA Class Block I/II/III design was completed in FY16 and installations started in FY17. A SHIPALT for VIRGINIA Class Block IV was developed in FY17 and installations will start in FY26, gradually phasing out the TEMPALTs on VIRGINIA Class. Reliability and refresh upgrades provide current in-service AASP systems with new components and software updates to maintain reliability.

WM019 - The Countermeasure Set, Acoustic (CSA) program procures and supports the inboard electronic system necessary for preparing and launching 6" (ADCs) from all 688i and newer U.S. submarines. The CSA program provides obsolescence support for legacy systems and engineering changes to accommodate advanced capabilities and planned new devices, such as the ADC MK5. Six efforts are supported: (1) the Technology Refresh effort is designing, building, testing and certifying replacement components for obsolete CSA MK2 systems (MOD 0/3/4) on 688i SSN and OHIO SSBN submarines, with the refresh occurring in FY17-FY20. (2) The CSA SWFTS Integration effort is integrating the CSA system with the Submarine Warfare Federated Tactical System (SWFTS) System of Systems (SoS) to facilitate the introduction of the ADC MK5 and the Submarine Torpedo Defense (SubTDS) Tactical Decision Aid (TacDA). A phased approach was taken to allow progressive implementation of initial capabilities. Required funding is expected to level off after ECL-launched ADC MK5 device fielding and will address recurring upgrades within the Submarine Warfare Federated Tactical System Technology Insertion (TI)/Advanced Processor Build (APB) cycles. (3) The CSA MK4 Technology Insertion effort replaces the CSA MK2 MOD2 with a SubTDS-capable, SWFTS-integrated CSA MK4 system on VIRGINIA Class Block I and II submarines (10 hulls). Non-recurring engineering, production testing, EQT and SHIPALT/Logistics documentation will complete in early FY19 with installs starting in late FY19. (4) The CSA SEAWOLF SWFTS Integration effort replaces the CSA MK2 MOD5 system on SEAWOLF Class submarines (3 hulls) with a  SubTDS-capable, SWFTS-integrated CSA system. The non-recurring engineering effort will begin in FY21 with fielding beginning in FY23 and the SWFTS TI-22 baseline. (5) The CSA SWFTS Virtualization effort supports the development and integration of the CSA system with the AN/BYG-1 Combat Control System on VIRGINIA and COLUMBIA new construction hulls. (6) The sixth effort is the ongoing support of engineering issues across all CSA systems as they arise.

[P40A / WM014 6 INCH]: WM014 6 INCH - The 6" Countermeasures program procures, reworks, and refreshes ADC MK3 (torpedo countermeasure) devices, ADC MK4 (SONAR countermeasure) devices, and associated Launch Tubes in order to maintain submarine fleet countermeasure device inventory levels in accordance with the Naval Munition Requirements Process
(NMRP). The 6" Countermeasure program tracks and implements device improvements through configuration control and an Engineering Change Proposal (ECP) process. A Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) was initiated in FY14 for ADC MK3 and MK4 devices to extend the usability of 6" devices. A new competitive production contract was awarded in late FY18 using risk management funds set aside for risks that didn't materialize, FY19 Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) funds were still used to do the majority of the initial engineering effort.

[P40A / WM015 3 INCH]: WM015 3 INCH - The 3" Countermeasures program procures ADC MK2 MODs 3, 5, and 7 countermeasure devices in order to maintain submarine fleet countermeasure device inventory levels in accordance with the NMRP. The 3" Countermeasures program tracks and implements device improvements through configuration control and the ECP process.

[P40A / NEXT GENERATION COUNTERMEASURE (NGCM) ADC MK5]: The Submarine Torpedo Defense System (SubTDS) Program to support a FY24 IOC will transition the ADC MK5 into production.

[P40A / WM022 GAS GENERATOR MK77]: WM022 Gas Generator MK 77 - The MK77 Gas Generator (GG) program procures the energetic components required to launch the ADC MK3 and ADC MK4 countermeasure devices from the External Countermeasure Launchers (ECLs). The GG program also reworks existing devices to extend their service life, and tracks and implements device improvements through configuration control and ECP process. A SLEP for MK77 MOD 0 devices was completed in FY16, resulted in extending the service life from two (2) to four (4) years for all devices except those installed aboard SSGN class submarines.

[P40A / WM830 PRODUCTION ENGINEERING]: WM830 -  Production Engineering - The Production Engineering line provides production engineering services for SAWS Technical Design Agent (TDA) and In-Service Engineering Agent (ISEA) across all SAWS systems, including AASP.  Also provides specification preparation and validation, government prepared production acceptance procedures, production planning, integrated logistics support, planning coordination of government furnished information and government furnished equipment, and contract administration including contract deliverable monitoring and prime contractor monitoring of cost/ schedule performance.

[P40A / PRODUCTION ENGINEERING]: Production Engineering adjustment commensurate with anticipated work.  To support the ordnance assessment that is planned to extend the service life.

[P40A / WM900 CONSULTING SERVICES]: WM900 Consulting Services - The Consulting Services line procures contractor support services for all SAWS programs including program, financial, acquisition, contract administration and engineering management support.

Justification.val:
FY 2020 SAWS increase procures more ADC MK2 to meet Fleet requirements. It also includes procurement of ADC MK3 and ADC MK4 on the new production contract (as the effort switched from NRE to production).

FY 2020 CSA increase is due to increased funding required to support virtualization and support meeting the SWFTS TI cycle.

Name.@footnote: Launch tubes and shipping containers are included in the unit cost for the ADC MK3 (Torpedo) and ADC MK4 (Sonar) new production buy in FY20.
In FY20 the ADC MK3 (Torpedo) Unit cost includes launch tubes and shipping containers.

ADC MK4 (Sonar) Unit cost is based on the pricing from the FY15 contract step ladder quantities (option was not exercised but it was the contract price) plus launch tubes and shipping containers escalated to FY20.
Based on projected unit costs when combined with Surface Ship ADCs additional units are available for procurement.

Cost of MK77 reflects only unit cost of MK77 MOD1 in new production. MK77 MOD1 GGs are procured as wholly new devices;  Unit cost includes prorated share of management and engineering oversight. MK77 MOD1 new production is broken out for clarification of units and unit cost where MK77 MOD0 rework is planned. The increase in APUC by 10% is the historical amount that has been added to the unit price to cover the engineering efforts of the ISEA and TDA.  This has normally been spread out across all devices.  Reduction in FY18 and FY19 due to update on inventory.
Name.val: 3.1) GAS GENERATOR MK77 MOD 1 NEW PRODUCTION

Name.@footnote: MK77 GGs Mod0 are broken out for clarification of units and unit cost because they are reworked units, not wholly new units. Reduction in FY18 and FY19 due to MK77 GG Mod 0 quantities update on inventory. Procurements occurring every other year starting FY18.  Unit cost in FY18 increased due to MK77 Mod 0 audit to certify rework, update inventory, MK77 Mod 0 SLEP.

Includes production support for SHIPALT 4678.  FY19 increase in 1.1.1 is due to installations and support.  These costs are for 2 FTE to manage the effort (including the IA requirements) and match with the SWFTS upgrade cycle.
An additional HLF-1 transducer is procured in FY19 ($610K) which increases the unit cost per system.
Name.val: 1.1.2) WM018 AASP (Acoustic Augmentation Support Program) - NonOrganic

Name.@footnote: Installations will occur one or two years after procurement due to long term availabilities scheduling.  Installation quantities updated in order to accommodate the current budget with the new increased installation cost.  One installation is planned in FY18 and two in FY19.
Name.val: 1.1.3) WM018 AASP Reliability and Refurbishment Upgrade - NonOrganic
1.2.1) WM018 AASP (Acoustic Augmentation Support Program) - Organic

Description.val:
The Acoustic Augmentation Support Program (AASP) provides acoustic augmenting systems in appropriate configurations for all submarine classes (except SEAWOLF) installed as temporary equipment (a TEMPALT). A permanently installed Ship Alteration (SHIPALT) configuration for VIRGINIA Class Block I/II/III was developed and installations started in FY17 (delayed from FY16 due because budget insufficient for installation cost estimates). A permanent SHIPALT for VIRGINIA Class Block IV was be developed in FY17 and installations will start in FY26, gradually phasing out the TEMPALTs on VIRGINIA Class. Reliability and refresh upgrades sustain current in-service AASP systems with new components and software updates to maintain reliability.

[WM018 AASP Support] Includes production support for BLK I-IV SHIPALTS and the AASP reliability and refurbishment upgrade.

[WM018 AASP (Acoustic Augmentation Support Program)] AASP includes costs of procuring new systems and reuse of available components, including the HLF-1, for SHIPALT installation such that "unit cost" is a mix of new and used components. An additional HLF-1 transducer (not a complete full system) was procured in FY19 ($610K).

[WM018 AASP Reliability and Refurbishment Upgrade] Reliability and refurbishment upgrade to sustain current in-service AASP systems.

[WM018 AASP (Acoustic Augmentation Support Program)] Non-recurring costs to produce AASP SHIPALT Package.

Name.@footnote: Installations were updated to reflect the current install schedule on Naval Tool for Interoperability Risk Assessment (NTIRA).

Description.val:
WM019 - The Countermeasure Set, Acoustic (CSA) program procures and supports the inboard electronic system necessary for preparing and launching 6" Acoustic Devices, Countermeasure (ADCs) from all 688i and newer U.S. submarines. This inboard system consists of the Torpedo Defense Controller (TDC), Launch Control Panels (LCPs), and associated cabling, in a class-by-class configuration. The CSA program provides obsolescence support for legacy systems and engineering changes to accommodate modified and planned new devices, such as the ADC MK5. Six efforts are supported: (1) the "Technology Refresh" effort is designing, building, testing and certifying replacement components for CSA MK2 systems (MOD 0/3/4) on 688i SSN and OHIO SSBN submarines, with the refresh occurring in FY17-FY20. (2) The "CSA SWFTS Integration" effort is integrating the CSA system with the Submarine Warfare Federated Tactical System (SWFTS) System of Systems (SoS) to facilitate the introduction of the ADC MK5 and the Submarine Torpedo Defense (SubTDS) Tactical Decision Aid (TacDA). A phased approach was taken to allow an incremental implementation of initial capabilities. Required funding is expected to level off after ECL-launched ADC MK5 device fielding and will address recurring upgrades within the SWFTS Technology Insertion (TI)/Advanced Processor Build (APB) cycles. (3) The "CSA MK4 Technology Insertion" effort replaces the CSA MK2 MOD2 with a SubTDS-capable, SWFTS-integrated CSA MK4 system on VIRGINIA Class Block I and II submarines (10 hulls). Non-recurring engineering, production testing, EQT and SHIPALT/Logistics documentation will complete in early FY19 with installs starting in late FY19. (4) The "CSA SEAWOLF SWFTS Integration" effort replaces the CSA MK2 MOD5 system on SEAWOLF Class submarines (3 hulls) with a  SubTDS-capable, SWFTS-integrated CSA system. The non-recurring engineering effort will begin in FY21 with fielding beginning in FY23 and the SWFTS TI-22 baseline. (5) The "CSA SWFTS Virtualization" effort supports the development and integration of the CSA system with the AN/BYG-1 Combat Control System on VIRGINIA and COLUMBIA new construction hulls. (6) The sixth effort is the ongoing support of engineering issues across all CSA systems as they arise.


NOTE: Beginning in FY20, the WM019 budget has been restructured to better align the CSA development and procurement efforts with the SWFTS TI/APB model. The changes reallocated funding entirely within the WM019 subhead to support current and future SWFTS development efforts. This restructuring will provide clarity to the recurring development and procurement costs associated with CSA systems and upgrades within the SWFTS TI/APB model.

[WM019 CSA MK3 Engineering Changes (LAN, SWFTS, TDA)] WM019 CSA MK3 Engineering Changes - Organic Technology insertion effort that supports and designs engineering changes for VA Blk III and following ships, including the Countermeasures Set Acoustic (CSA) system, Torpedo Defense Controller (TDC), and Launch Control Panels (LCPs). This supports changes to correct obsolescence, support SWFTS modernization goals and engineering changes necessary to accommodate modified devices and new devices, such as the ADC MK5.

[WM019 ECPs CSA MK2 MOD 2 Conversion to MK 4] WM019 - ECPs CSA MK2 MOD2 Conversion to CSA MK4 - Organic Technology insertion effort that converts CSA MK2 MOD2 to CSA MK4 to accommodate introduction of ADC MK5 to Virginia Class Block 1 and 2 Ships (10 hulls). Proofing completed in FY18, with replacement installations starting in FY19 to better align with overall submarine availabilities scheduling.

[WM019 CSA MK2 MOD 0 OBSOLESCENCE] WM019 - CSA MK2 MOD0 Obsolescence - NonOrganic Technology refresh effort that designs, builds, tests and certifies replacement components for obsolete CSA MK2 MOD4 on 688i ships and CSA MK2 MOD0 and 3 on SSBNs. Upgrades will occur in FY17-FY20.

[WM019 CSAMK2 MOD2 CONVERSION to CSA MK4] WM019 - CSA MK2 MOD2 Conversion to CSA MK4 - Non Organic Technology Insertion effort that procures engineering change kits and systems including Countermeasures Set Acoustic (CSA) system, Torpedo Defense Controller (TDC), Launch Control Panels (LCPs), and CSA support system assets to correct obsolescence, including engineering changes necessary to accommodate modified devices and new devices, such as the ADC MK5.

[WM019 CSAMK3 Kits and Systems] WM019 - CSA MK3 Kits and Systems - NonOrganic Procures engineering change kits and systems in support of SAWS including Countermeasures Set Acoustic (CSA) system, Torpedo Defense Controller (TDC), Launch Control Panels (LCPs), CSA support system assets to correct obsolescence, including engineering changes necessary to accommodate modified devices and new devices, such as the ADC MK5.

[WM019 CSA MK3 Engineering Changes  - Organic] WM019 CSA Engineering Changes - Organic Technology insertion effort that supports and designs engineering changes for the Countermeasure Set, Acoustic (CSA) systems fielded on all 688i and newer U.S. submarines. This supports changes to correct obsolescence, and engineering changes necessary to accommodate modified devices and new devices, such as the ADC MK5.

[WM019 CSA Technology Insertion (TI-20) Upgrade Kits NonOrganic] WM019 CSA Technology Insertion (TI-20) - NonOrganic Procures CSA Technology Insertion to upgrade fielded SWFTS-integrated CSA systems from TI-14 and TI-16 to TI-20 on VIRGINIA Class submarines.

[WM019 CSA MK3 Technology Insertion (TI-22) Upgrade Kits NonOrganic] WM019 CSA Technology Insertion (TI-22)  - NonOrganic Procures CSA Technology Insertion  to upgrade legacy CSA MK2 MOD 5 systems to TI-22 on SEAWOLF Class submarines.

[WM019 CSA MK3 Technology Insertion (TI-24) Upgrade Kits NonOrganic] WM019 CSA Technology Insertion (TI-24) - NonOrganic Procures CSA Technology Insertion to upgrade fielded SWFTS-integrated CSA systems from TI-16 and TI-20 to TI-24 on VIRGINIA Class submarines.

[WM019 CSA SWFTS VIRTUALIZATION - Organic] WM019 - CSA SWFTS VIRTUALIZATION Organic Nonrecurring costs for the development, testing and migration of CSA functionality into the AN/BYG-1 Combat Control System and the Payload Control System (PCS) on SWFTS.

[WM019 CSA SEA WOLF SWFTS Integration - Organic] WM019 - CSA SEAWOLF SWFTS Integration Organic Nonrecurring costs for the development, testing, and SHIPALT for the SWFTS-integrated CSA on SEAWOLF in TI-22.

[WM019 CSA MK2 MOD 2 Conversion to CSA MK4] WM019 - CSA MK2 MOD2 Conversion to CSA MK4 - Organic Nonrecurring costs for the Technology Insertion CSA MK4.

[WM019 CSA ISEA] WM019 - CSA ISEA Supports engineering issues across all systems and platforms as they arise, using ISEA support.
